required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multicenter Study to Evaluate a New Robotic Device for Image-guided Percutaneous Needle Placement
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Safety and Performance of the Quantum Surgical Robotic Device for Image-guided Percutaneous Needle Placement

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the safety and performance of a new robotic device in the treatment of hepatic thermoablation in adults. The new robotic device will be used in all patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
The device is a user controlled, stereotactic accessory intended to assist in the planning and manual advancement of needle, as well as in verification of needle position during CT guided percutaneous ablation procedures.
After validation of the correct positioning of the needle, the tumor ablation procedure is conducted with a device routinely used by the investigator. The Acquisition of a post-interventional CT-guided image is realized to evaluate adverse events occurrence.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the safety related to the procedure
primary_outcome.description: Number of Adverse Event(s) that are considered to be major and are attributable to the needle insertion phase of the procedure

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the feasibility of the Quantum Surgical device: Number of targets reached
primary_outcome.description: Number of targets reached; the target is considered to have been reached when the needle is positioned accurately enough to allow the next step of the procedure to be carried out

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the accuracy of the device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the needle placement accuracy (distance from the needle tip to the target)

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the needle readjustments of the device
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the number of needle readjustments to reach the target

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the safety not related to the procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: All Adverse Event(s) except those considered major and are attributable to the needle insertion phase of the procedure

arm_group.description: Needle placement to the tumor, one time, the day of the ablation procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient is at least 18 years old,
- Patient for whom an ablation procedure under CT guidance in liver organ has been prescribed and consensually agreed by a multidisciplinary team of radiologists, surgeons and clinicians,
- Patient not taking platelet antiaggregant or having stopped taking it for 5 days and not taking anticoagulant (thrombocytes â‰¥ 50 000/mm3, TP > 50%),
- Patient who agrees to participate in the evaluation and who has signed the inform consent,
- Patient covered by social security system.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient unable to undergo general anesthesia,
- Patient unable to tolerate CT contrast agent
- Patient already participating in another clinical study
- Pregnant or breast-feeding woman.
